pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people wearing a headdress. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:7.2: “‘I will not give teachings to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:8.2: if the ends of the hair are not showing it is a headdress.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:9.1: One should not give teachings to anyone wearing a headdress who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:9.2: If a monk out of disrespect gives teachings to someone wearing a headdress who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:10.6: if he teaches the person after getting them to uncover the ends of their hair;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:10.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk66:11.1: The sixth training rule is finished.
